# Overview

The **Hip Hub** is an interactive R/Shiny dashboard that synthesizes hip anatomy visuals, common pathologies, assessment tools, prevention strategies, intervention options, and embedded documentation into one cohesive experience. The app is designed for learners aged **18–45**, balancing interactivity, clarity, and **guideline-backed** content.

Core nonpharmacologic care for hip/knee osteoarthritis (OA)—**exercise**, **patient education**, and **weight management**—is emphasized throughout the Hub \(American College of Rheumatology/Arthritis Foundation \[ACR/AF\], 2019; Osteoarthritis Research Society International \[OARSI\], 2019\). Global radiographic hip OA prevalence is ~**8.55%** and increases with age; U.S. burden rose ~**24–25%** from 1990 to 2019 \(Fan et al., 2023; Sayyed et al., 2025\).

> Sources:
> - ACR/AF Guideline (2019): <https://rheumatology.org/osteoarthritis-guideline>
> - OARSI Guideline (2019): <https://www.esceo.org/sites/esceo/files/pdf/Bannuru_O%26C_OARSIguidelines_2019.pdf>
> - Fan et al., 2023: <https://link.springer.com/content/pdf/10.1186/s13075-023-03033-7.pdf>
> - Sayyed et al., 2025: <https://bmjopen.bmj.com/content/15/10/e096130>

# Design Goals

1. **Tab-scoped interactivity**: Age/Sex filters live only in *Common Pathologies* and drive both a **Plotly** bar chart and a **matching age×sex image**.
2. **Responsive visuals**: CSS constraints (`max-width:100%; height:auto;`) ensure graphs and images **never overlap**.
3. **Uniform home images**: A consistent 2×2 grid establishes visual context and reduces jitter.
4. **Embedded evidence**: Short, readable summaries appear beside content with **live citations**.
5. **Reproducibility**: `info.Rmd` auto-renders to `info.html` on first run.

# Installation & Dependencies

```r
# R >= 4.1 recommended
install.packages(c("shiny", "bs4Dash", "plotly", "rmarkdown"))
```

# How to Run

1. Place **all image assets** in the `www/` folder per the file structure below.
2. Place the **six age×sex images** in `www/pathologies/`.
3. Open R and run:

```r
shiny::runApp("app.R")
```

On first run, if `info.html` does not exist, the app will **render** `info.Rmd` to `info.html` and include it in the *Documentation* tab automatically.

# Tabs & Features

## Home
Uniform **hip anatomy** images shown in a 2×2 grid at equal height. This establishes visual context and helps orient new users.

## Common Pathologies
Age and sex filters update a **prevalence bar chart** and a **matching age×sex pathology image**. Evidence highlights summarize sex-linked morphology patterns—**cam-type FAI more common in males; pincer-type more frequent in females; mixed type prevalent in both** \(Zhou et al., 2021; Owen et al., 2023\)—and global/U.S. OA burden \(Fan et al., 2023; Sayyed et al., 2025\).

> Sources:
> - Zhou et al., 2021: <https://academic.oup.com/jhps/article/8/3/233/6307732>
> - Owen et al., 2023: <https://europepmc.org/article/PMC/PMC10403993>

## Prevention & Maintenance
Guideline-backed recommendations for **exercise**, **mobility**, and **self-management** are presented with inline citations (ACR/AF, 2019; OARSI, 2019). Emphasis includes **aerobic activity (≥150 min/week)**, **hip abduction strengthening**, **balance drills**, and **weight management** (≥5% loss associated with improved pain/function; AAFP synopsis).

> Sources:
> - ACR/AF Guideline (2019): <https://rheumatology.org/osteoarthritis-guideline>
> - OARSI Guideline (2019): <https://www.esceo.org/sites/esceo/files/pdf/Bannuru_O%26C_OARSIguidelines_2019.pdf>
> - AAFP synopsis (2021): <https://www.aafp.org/pubs/afp/issues/2021/0115/p120.html>

## Intervention Options
Conservative care follows **impairment-based phases** (load management → mobility → strength → return to sport), with short-term analgesic strategies as clinically appropriate (AAFP, 2021). Recovery expectations after hip arthroscopy reflect **early pain reduction**, **function plateau ~4 months**, and **activity plateau ~7 months** \(Lutz et al., 2025; Ramos et al., 2020; Grzybowski et al., 2015\).

> Sources:
> - Heerey et al., 2018: <https://www.jospt.org/doi/pdf/10.2519/jospt.2018.8002>
> - AAFP 2021: <https://www.aafp.org/pubs/afp/issues/2021/0115/p120.html>
> - Lutz et al., 2025: <https://academic.oup.com/jhps/article/12/Supplement_1/i125/8099723>
> - Ramos et al., 2020: <https://journals.sagepub.com/doi/pdf/10.1177/2325967120960689>
> - Grzybowski et al., 2015: <https://www.frontiersin.org/journals/surgery/articles/10.3389/fsurg.2015.00021/full>

## Assessment
Clinical tests include **FADIR** (sensitive, less specific), **Arlington** (higher sensitivity), and **Twist** (higher specificity), complemented by **FABER/Scour/Thomas**. Imaging workflow begins with **radiographs**, followed by **MR arthrography** for suspected labral pathology and **CT** for 3D planning \(Adib et al., 2023; Physiopedia, n.d.\).

> Sources:
> - Adib et al., 2023: <https://www.nirschl.com/pdf/two-novel-clinical-tests-for-diagnosis-of-hip-labral-tears.pdf>
> - Physiopedia (FADIR overview): <https://www.physio-pedia.com/FADIR_%28Flexion,_Adduction,_Internal_Rotation%29_Test>

## Documentation
The *Documentation* tab embeds `info.html` (rendered from `info.Rmd`) and lists references for quick verification and further reading.

# Data & Reactivity

The app scaffolds a small **prevalence** data frame across **AgeGroup × Sex × Condition** using mock values for demonstration. This structure can be replaced by validated subgroup prevalence tables without altering reactive logic. The **Plotly** bar chart and **age×sex image** both respond to `input$path_age` and `input$path_sex`.

# Assets & Naming Conventions

- Home page images (root `www/`):
  - `hip_anatomy.png`, `hip_anatomy2.png`, `hip_anatomy3.png`, `hip_anatomy_4.jpeg` (uniform height)
- Age×Sex pathology images (`www/pathologies/`):
  - `Adolescent_Male_pathology.png`, `Adolescent_Female_pathology.png`,
  - `Adult_Male_pathology.png`, `Adult_Female_pathology.png`,
  - `Older_Adult_Male_pathology.png`, `Older_Adult_Female_pathology.png`

# Customization

- **Figure sizing**: Adjust the `height` argument where `img_if_exists()` is called; keep CSS constraints for responsiveness.
- **Card widths**: Change `width` in `bs4Card()` (values sum to 12 across a row).
- **Evidence blocks**: Edit the HTML bullet strings and URLs directly within each tab.

# Reproducibility

- Deterministic seed (`set.seed(5430)`) for mock data.
- Auto-render of `info.Rmd` → `info.html` on first run via `rmarkdown::render()` in `app.R`.
- Clear `www/` strategy for static assets.
